oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A survey of herd-level risk factors for bovine respiratory disease (BRD) in nursing beef calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Woolums, A. R.
Berghaus, R. D.
Smith, D. R.
White, B. J.
Engelken, T. J.
Irsik, M.
Matlik, D. K.
Jones, A. L.
Ellis, R. W.
Smith, L. J.
Mason, G. L.
Waggoner, E. R.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bovine respiratory disease
management modification
risk factors
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Surveys by the USDA confirm that bovine respiratory disease (BRD) is the leading cause of death of nursing (preweaned) beef calves three weeks of age and older. Management modifications decrease BRD in some cattle populations; however, management-related risk factors for BRD in nursing calves are poorly characterized, making it difficult to develop evidence-based control measures.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2012; 219
